lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the main opposition bloc said it wanted an assurance from Secretary General Ban Ki-moon that the Syrian government would lift its sieges of rebel-held towns.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from Geneva, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Karen Zraick contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ANNE BARNARD

headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition Bloc Still Won’t Commit to Joining Peace Talks
headline.main: Syrian Opposition Bloc Still Won’t Commit to Joining Peace Talks

snippet: A spokesman for the main opposition bloc said it wanted an assurance from Secretary General Ban Ki-moon that the Syrian government would lift its sieges of rebel-held towns.
abstract: Opposition parties in Syrian conflict say they will not attend Geneva peace talks unless United Nations Sec Gen Ban K-moon guarantees Syrian government will lift sieges on rebel-held towns; United States and Saudi Arabia-backed bloc is under intense pressure as Russian military assistance increasingly bolsters Pres Bashar al-Assad's regime.
